s0601: You Wang's first year, he attacked Wei.
s0602: In the fourth year, You Wang died, and his son Ai Wang Shen ascended the throne.
s0603: Ai Wang's first year, he attacked Song.
s0604: In the second year, Ai Wang died, and his son Shen Wang Hao ascended the throne.
s0605: What Qi trusted Han with was making Han Gong Zi Mei prime minister of Qi.
s0606: Han had already obtained Wu Sui from Qin, and the king greatly favored it, sending Mei to Qi and Han to meet Mao Li Ji. Ji obtained the weight of Qi and Han, so his lord did not dare abandon Ji.
s0607: Now if we add Chu's weight to this, Mao Li Zi will surely speak to Qin to return the invaded land to Chu.'
s0608: Therefore Hui Wang agreed to it, ultimately not allying with Qin but allying with Qi to benefit Han.
s0609: In the twenty-fourth year, he betrayed Qi and allied with Qin.
s0610: Qin Zhao Wang first ascended the throne and heavily bribed Chu.
s0611: Chu went to welcome the bride.
s0612: In the twenty-fifth year, Hui Wang entered and formed an alliance with Qin Zhao Wang at Huang Ji.
s0613: Qin returned Shang Yong to Chu.
s0614: In the twenty-sixth year, Qi, Han, and Wei resented Chu for betraying their alliance and allying with Qin, so the three states together attacked Chu.
s0615: Chu sent the crown prince as hostage to Qin to request aid.
s0616: Qin then sent the Guest Minister Tong to lead troops to rescue Chu, and the three states withdrew their troops.
s0617: In the twenty-seventh year, a Qin grand master privately fought with the Chu crown prince, and the Chu crown prince killed him and fled back.
s0618: In the twenty-eighth year, Qin then allied with Qi, Han, and Wei to attack Chu together, killing the Chu general Tang Mei and taking Chu's Chong Qiu before leaving.
s0619: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin again attacked Chu, greatly defeating them, with twenty thousand Chu soldiers dying and killing Chu's general Jing Que.
s0620: Hui Wang was afraid and sent the crown prince as hostage to Qi to seek peace.
s0621: In the thirtieth year, Qin again attacked Chu, taking eight cities.
s0622: Qin Zhao Wang sent a letter to the Chu king: 'Initially I and the king agreed to be brothers, forming an alliance at Huang Ji, with the crown prince as hostage - this was very pleasant.
s0623: The crown prince arrogantly killed my important minister without apologizing and fled away. I truly cannot contain my anger, so I sent troops to invade the king's borders.
s0624: Now I hear the king has sent the crown prince as hostage to Qi to seek peace.
s0625: I and Chu share bordering lands, so we intermarried, and our alliance has been close for a long time.
s0626: But now Qin and Chu are not on good terms, which makes it impossible to command the feudal lords.
s0627: I wish to meet the king at Wu Guan, make a face-to-face agreement, form an alliance, and leave - this is my wish.
s0628: I dare to inform your officials.'
s0629: Chu Hui Wang saw Qin's letter and was troubled by it.
s0630: He wanted to go but feared being deceived;
s0631: if he did not go, he feared Qin would be angry.
s0632: Zhao Sui said: 'Your Majesty should not go, but raise troops to defend yourself.
s0633: Qin is like a tiger or wolf, cannot be trusted - they have intentions to swallow the feudal lords.'
s0634: Hui Wang's son Zi Lan urged the king to go, saying: 'How can we break Qin's friendly intentions!'
s0635: Therefore he went to meet Qin Zhao Wang.
s0636: Zhao Wang deceitfully ordered a general to hide troops at Wu Guan, calling himself Qin Wang.
s0637: When the Chu king arrived, they closed Wu Guan and escorted him west to Xian Yang, where he attended court at Zhang Tai like a vassal, without equal ritual.
s0638: Chu Hui Wang was greatly angered and regretted not listening to Zhao Sui's words.
s0639: Qin detained the Chu king and demanded the cession of the Wu and Qian Zhong commanderies.
s0640: The Chu king wanted to form an alliance, but Qin wanted to get the land first.
s0641: The Chu king angrily said: 'Qin has deceived me and now forcibly demands land from me!'
s0642: He would not agree to Qin again.
s0644: The Chu ministers were troubled and plotted together: 'Our king is in Qin and cannot return, they demand the cession of land, and the crown prince is hostage in Qi. If Qi and Qin conspire together, then Chu will have no state.'
s0645: They wanted to establish a son of Hui Wang who was in the country.
s0646: Zhao Sui said: 'The king and crown prince are both trapped by the feudal lords, and now if we go against the king's command and establish his illegitimate son, it is not proper.'
s0647: He deceitfully reported to Qi that Qi Min Wang told his prime minister: 'It would be better to detain the crown prince to demand Chu's Huai Bei.'
s0648: The prime minister said: 'This cannot be done. If Ying establishes a king, then we are holding an empty hostage and acting unjustly toward the world.'
s0650: If Ying establishes a king, then bargain with their new king saying 'Give me the lower eastern region, and I will have the king kill the crown prince, otherwise I will ally with the three states to establish him', then the eastern region can surely be obtained.'
s0651: Qi Wang ultimately used his prime minister's plan and returned the Chu crown prince.
s0652: The crown prince Heng arrived and was established as king, becoming Qing Xiang Wang.
s0653: He announced to Qin: 'Relying on the spirits of the altars of soil and grain, the state has a king.'
s0655: Qing Xiang Wang Heng's first year, Qin demanded Hui Wang but could not get the land. Chu established a king to respond to Qin, so Qin Zhao Wang was angry and sent troops out of Wu Guan to attack Chu, greatly defeating the Chu army, beheading fifty thousand, taking fifteen cities of Xi, and leaving.
s0656: In the second year, Qin again attacked Chu, taking sixteen cities.
s0657: In the third year, Qin attacked Chu again.
s0658: In the fourth year, Qin defeated Chu troops, killing the general Tang Mei.
s0659: In the fifth year, Qin attacked Chu, taking twenty cities.
s0660: In the sixth year, Qin defeated Chu, taking the Chu crown prince Heng hostage.
s0661: In the seventh year, Qin attacked Chu, taking five cities.
s0662: In the eighth year, Chu attacked Qin, taking two cities.
s0663: In the ninth year, Qin attacked Chu, taking two cities.

s0666: In the twelfth year, Qin attacked Chu, taking three cities.
